timeline.message:
WIP: Introduce dynamic cluster change handler in HelixClusterManager

Dynamic cluster change handler is another implementation of cluster
change handler. Unlike simple cluster change handler which only create
instance/partition/replica during initialization, dynamic cluster change
handler supports adding new partition/node/replica at runtime. Also it
supports removing replica from existing node. With this change,
spectators in cluster are able to update membership list of
instances/partitions and location of replicas without reboot. Moreover,
the cluster metrics are also updated at runtime (i.e. cluster wide
capacity, number of partitions etc)
more tests for dynamic cluster change handler
added java docs and more test cases

timeline.bodyText:
General question: What happens when exceptions get thrown inside of helix listener callbacks? Would future notifications be received?
Throwing at this point in the middle of the loop could create some inconsistency since clusterChangeHandlerCallback.addReplicasToPartition is called on every iteration of the loop, but ambryDataNodeToAmbryReplicas is updated after the loop. If this is an issue, you could move the clusterChangeHandlerCallback.addReplicasToPartition call to after the loop.
